metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22817 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PIL.ImageMath.eval in Pillow before 9.0.0 allows evaluation of arbitrary expressions, such as ones that use the Python exec method. A lambda expression could also be used,

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.6
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> upstream mentions in the readthedocs page for version 9.0.1 (https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/9.0.1.html) that the fix for this CVE applied in version 9.0.0 (commit 8531b01d6c) does not completely patch the vulnerability. A new commit, dd46100bdc, was added in order to completely fix the issue. mdeslaur> switching releases back to needed due to incomplete fix

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.6').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
